page.title: 02WITNESHAM,CLAYDON SCHOOLS
page.content: CHILDREN BETWEEN 5 AND 11 YEARS, UNLESS ATTENDING PRIVATE EDUCATION, ARE EDUCATED EITHER AT HENLEY OR WITNESHAM COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOLS. HENLEY SCHOOL IS DEALT WITH UNDER HOUSING. WITNESHAM PRIMARY SCHOOL PROVIDES EDUCATION FOR 85 PRIMARY CHILDREN.THE PRESENT HEAD TEACHER BEING MRS.C.A.DAVIES CHILDREN TRANSFER TO CLAYDON HIGH SCHOOL AT 11 YEARS. FEW PARENTS TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE RIGHT TO PLACE THEIR CHILD IN THE SCHOOL OF THEIR CHOICE. LOCAL PEOPLE REMEMBER THE SCHOOL AS IT WAS 26 YEARS AGO. THEN IT TAUGHT CHILDREN UP TO THE AGE OF 14. THE SCHOOL HAS THREE TEACHERS AND NON-TEACHING STAFF HOURS HAVE BEEN AND CONTINUE TO BE CUT.
